reviews.text: We just got back from 4 nights at the BHH. Unlike the last post, I felt that the staff was incredibly attentive and kind. The hotel was beautiful and we got upgraded to a junior suite with gorgeous views because our room was not ready at 12 noon. This is ~4 hrs before check-in time.

likes.disliked: — the added fees for internet, parking, breakfast expense

reviews.text: We stayed with 2 children (ages 3 & 6). The kids were treated well and given drink passes for all the soda that they could drink at the pool. They were provided with kid bathrobes and a bunny on the bathtub faucet. In fact when we changed hotels to the Del Coranado in San Diego my 3 yr old cried because it wasn't as pretty as the BHH.
reviews.title: Excellent service steeped in history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only disappointment came with some "nickle and diming" issues. The package we reserved included breakfast however it turned out it was only good for $80- for the four of us. The first morning our breakfast bill was $100- before tip. We met the budget only if I had 1/2 a grapefruit for breakfast and my family had meals without sides. The other issues were a $10- /day wireless internet charge, a hefty hotel tax, an unknown $5- hotel charge and a $29-/night parking charge.
reviews.title: nice hotel, terrible service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I loved it but my husband was less than thrilled.
reviews.title: Everything was perfect...or better.
Lived Up To Every Expectation
reviews.text: We took our teenage daughter to the BHH to do a fun Beverly Hills trip during Spring Break. Having been in the hotel business ourselves, my husband and I were most impressed with the guest recognition and personal service offered by the staff. We were addressed by name at the front desk and restaurants, and shown to our "regular" table each evening for cocktails and in the morning for breakfast. The room was spacious and comfortable (I recommend a Deluxe room if you need to add a rollaway, as we did). The history of the hotel makes it quite special, unlike a cookie-cutter name brand. Appreciate the BHH for what it is, and enjoy it. Oh, and a terrific place for star sightings: we saw Demi Moore, Orlando Bloom, and Matthew Perry.

reviews.title: I haven't even stayed here......
reviews.text: We were unable to sleep for our nights stay as there was an incessant drone from the extractor fan for the air con that was located next to our room. The engineer said there was nothing he could do about it and the hotel did not offer an alternative room. I complained to the manager in the morning who was friendly enough but did not appreciate the fact that we had spent nearly $400 in a room that we could not sleep in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just think we were unlucky in the room we got.
reviews.title: Impeccable Service

reviews.text: This is a very lovely hotel, in a very lovely setting. Our room was a standard but very nicely furnished. Bathroom was very nice with seperate toilet and lots of space. The communcal areas are also very nicely decorated, and the grounds and very nice to walk around. We had one breakfast in the Fountain Room which was very good, if you want to go at the weekend get there early as we were lucky - others queued for 30 mins for seats. Dinner in the Polo Lounge was fantastic. Wonderful food and great service. My only complain if it can be called that was the size of the portions! We opted for the tasting menu, however the portions felt like generous main courses - 6 of them!! Needless to say we rolled out!!
reviews.title: I Love This Place!!

likes.liked: — The level of service mixed with the level of privacy.

description: The Beverly Hills Hotel is a luxury, five-star hotel, located on Sunset Boulevard in the center of Beverly Hills and surrounded by 12 acres of lush, tropical gardens, exotic flowers, and private walkways. Providing privacy and tranquility in a truly residential setting, The Beverly Hills Hotel is within easy access to the business and entertainment centers of Los Angeles, Century City, Rodeo Drive, and many of the Hollywood studios. The hotel is just a 35-minute drive from Los Angeles International Airport. Referred to locally as "The Pink Palace" The Beverly Hills Hotel is a place to see and be seen, to catch glimpses of famous faces, or to revel in splendid luxury. What makes The Beverly Hills Hotel stand out is its superlative combination of service, a location that offers guests privacy, yet in the heart of a city, and a refreshed facility that, while faithful to the hotel's architectural and interior design traditions, is more dramatically beautiful than ever.
